abstract.p: Foot Locker National Interscholastic track and field championships held, Raleigh, NC; results noted (S)

block.p: It was almost midnight Saturday when Dathan Ritzenheim of Rockford (Mich.) High School finished his team's distance medley relay victory for his third gold medal at the Foot Locker National Interscholastic Championships in Raleigh, N.C.

The team finished in 10 minutes 3.09 seconds. Late Friday night, Ritzenheim had crushed an outstanding field in the two-mile run with a 50-meter victory in 8:48.06 and at 10 a.m. Saturday he anchored Rockford's four-mile relay to victory with a 4:12.2 mile split. His mile split on the distance medley was 4:09.7.

It was almost midnight Saturday when Dathan Ritzenheim of Rockford (Mich.) High School finished his team's distance medley relay victory for his third gold medal at the Foot Locker National Interscholastic Championships in Raleigh, N.C.

The team finished in 10 minutes 3.09 seconds. Late Friday night, Ritzenheim had crushed an outstanding field in the two-mile run with a 50-meter victory in 8:48.06 and at 10 a.m. Saturday he anchored Rockford's four-mile relay to victory with a 4:12.2 mile split. His mile split on the distance medley was 4:09.7.
Neisha Bernard Thomas of Brooklyn's Tilden High School won the girls' 800-meter run in 2:06.55, a personal best, and anchored Tilden's winning 1,600-meter sprint medley relay (3:55.16).
